refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The input operator works exactly the same way as load, except it does NOT store the data unless the INTO clause or the AFL store operator is present.

The instance_id argument allows you to select which SciDB instance you want to input into. To see a list of SciDB instances running on your system, use the list('instances') operator. For more details of the syntax, see .

informalexample.para:
This example reads a SciDB-formatted file from the examples directory.
AFL% create array m4x4 <val1:int32, val2:int32>[i=0:3,4,0, j=0:3,4,0]; AFL% input(m4x4,'../tests/harness/testcases/data/doc/m4x4_missing.txt'); [ [(0,100),(1,99),(2,98),(3,97)], [(4,0),(5,95),(6,94),(7,93)], [(8,92),(9,91),(),(11,89)], [(12,88),(13,0),(14,86),(15,85)] ]

But note that the m4x4 array is emptyâ€”the data was not stored during the execution of the input operation.
AFL% scan(m4x4); [[]]
